predictions.text: U.S. unemployment rate (U-3, seasonally adjusted) for September 2025 will print between 4.0% and 4.2% in the BLS Employment Situation on 2025-10-03.
predictions.verification_criteria: Confirmed if BLS Employment Situation news release Table A-1 shows the seasonally adjusted unemployment rate between 4.0% and 4.2%.
monitoring_signals: Seasonally adjusted initial jobless claims and 4-week average
predictions.rationale: ADP’s negative print and softer survey employment components point to cooling labor demand without a sharp deterioration.

predictions.text: U.S. labor force participation rate (seasonally adjusted) for September 2025 will print between 62.6% and 62.9% in the BLS Employment Situation on 2025-10-03.
predictions.verification_criteria: Confirmed if BLS Employment Situation Table A-1 shows the seasonally adjusted labor force participation rate within 62.6%–62.9%.
monitoring_signals: Household survey participation movements by age group
predictions.rationale: Participation has been range-bound and tends to adjust gradually; no major shock suggests stability near recent levels.

predictions.text: U.S. Average Weekly Hours of All Employees (Total Private, seasonally adjusted) for September 2025 will print between 34.3 and 34.4 hours in the BLS Employment Situation on 2025-10-03.
predictions.verification_criteria: Confirmed if BLS Employment Situation Table B-2 (Total private) shows average weekly hours between 34.3 and 34.4.
monitoring_signals: ISM supplier delivery and employment sub-indexes
predictions.rationale: Hours typically move slowly; recent softness argues against an uptick, keeping hours near 34.3–34.4.

predictions.text: U.S. U-6 underemployment rate (seasonally adjusted) for September 2025 will print between 7.6% and 8.2% in the BLS Employment Situation on 2025-10-03.
predictions.verification_criteria: Confirmed if BLS Employment Situation Table A-15 shows the seasonally adjusted U-6 rate within 7.6%–8.2%.
predictions.rationale: Cooling demand and elevated PTER historically keep U-6 roughly 3–4 points above U-3, implying high-7s to low-8s.

predictions.text: ISM Services Prices Index for September 2025 will print between 56.0 and 61.0 in ISM’s report released on 2025-10-03.
predictions.verification_criteria: Confirmed if the ISM Services Report On Business shows the ‘Prices’ index for September within 56.0–61.0.
monitoring_signals: Energy and fuel price movements (Brent/WTI, diesel)
Supplier delivery times and input cost anecdotes
predictions.rationale: Moderating demand and easing supply frictions should keep services input inflation elevated but off peak levels.

predictions.text: NYMEX WTI crude oil front-month futures (CL) will settle at or above $90.00 per barrel on at least one trading day by 2025-10-31.
predictions.verification_criteria: Confirmed if CME Group’s official daily settlement price for the prompt WTI (CL) contract is ≥ $90.00/bbl on any trading day through 2025-10-31 (UTC).
monitoring_signals: Geopolitical risk premia (Middle East escalation indicators)
predictions.rationale: Elevated geopolitical risk and disciplined OPEC+ supply alongside resilient demand raise odds of a $90+ WTI print.

predictions.text: U.S. On-Highway Diesel Fuel Price (EIA, U.S. average) will print at or below $3.90 per gallon in at least one weekly update published by 2025-11-15.
predictions.verification_criteria: Confirmed if EIA’s ‘Weekly Retail On-Highway Diesel Prices’ shows the U.S. average ≤ $3.90/gal in any weekly release through 2025-11-15.
monitoring_signals: WTI/Brent price trends and crack spreads
Distillate inventories and days of supply (EIA)
predictions.rationale: Seasonal shoulder demand, improving distillate stocks, and soft freight could cap diesel prices despite crude volatility.

predictions.text: U.S. field production of crude oil (monthly, EIA Petroleum Supply Monthly) for August 2025 will be at or above 13.4 million barrels per day in the report published by 2025-10-31.
predictions.verification_criteria: Confirmed if EIA Petroleum Supply Monthly (Table 5.1 or series for U.S. field production of crude oil) reports ≥ 13.4 million b/d for August 2025.
monitoring_signals: EIA weekly production estimates revisions vs monthly
Pipeline takeaway capacity and midstream updates
predictions.rationale: Productivity gains and steady Permian output growth suggest monthly production will print a fresh high near/above 13.4 mb/d.

predictions.text: By 2025-11-30, Intel and AMD will announce that AMD will use Intel Foundry Services to manufacture at least one product line, via a joint press release or concurrent statements on both companies’ investor relations sites.
predictions.verification_criteria: Confirmed if a joint press release or matching announcements on both Intel and AMD official IR/press pages state AMD will have a product manufactured by Intel Foundry Services.
monitoring_signals: Foundry customer disclosures at Intel events
Reports from trade press (SemiAnalysis, DIGITIMES, Bloomberg)
predictions.rationale: Strategic alignment helps Intel fill advanced nodes and diversifies AMD supply amid geopolitical and capacity considerations.

predictions.text: The U.S. 10-Year Treasury Inflation-Indexed Security yield (FRED: DFII10) will close at or below 1.80% on at least one trading day by 2025-11-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Confirmed if FRED series DFII10 shows a daily close ≤ 1.80% on any trading day through 2025-11-30 (UTC).
monitoring_signals: Fed communications and rate-cut expectations (OIS/ED futures)
predictions.rationale: Weaker growth signals and dovish risk skew support lower real yields despite inflation uncertainty.
